page.title: 17Housing:Child's Survey
page.content: A large part of the area is residential,the oldest house we saw was built in 1740-a detached house on Gilbert Bank. The houses on Redhouse Lane are terraced houses built in 1865(Church Terrace) 1887(Church Villas) 1902(Brookfield) and 1915. On Brookfield Avenue there are 3 police houses, a pair of semi-detached and a detached house. Most were built after the second World War.A wallpaper factory has been pulled down and in its place a new estate is being built called Churchfields. 120 houses will be built. The prices of these houses range from Â£23,800 to Â£35,000. The houses at Lowick Green are 4 years old mainly bungalows, detached or semi detached houses. At the bottom of Mill Lane there are some mobile homes,4 years old, owned by E Ogden a local farmer.
